CHAINED.Definition: to fasten someone or something using a chain

‍RAILINGS.Definition: vertical posts, usually metal or wooden, that are used together with other such posts to form a fence

‍SMASHED.Definition: to cause something to break noisily into a lot of small pieces

‍STATUS.Definition: an accepted or official position, especially in a social group

‍PAINT A PICTURE.Definition: to describe or show something in a particular way

‍SUMMARISE.Definition: to express the most important facts or ideas about something or someone in a short and clear form

‍BLEAK.Definition: if a situation is bleak, there is little or no hope for the future

‍PROSPECTS.Definition: the possibility that something good might happen in the future

‍RESTRICTED.Definition: limited, especially by official rules, laws, etc.

‍UNIVERSAL SUFFRAGE.Definition: everyone having the right to vote

‍PARLIAMENT.Definition: in some countries, the group of (usually) elected politicians or other people who make the laws for their country

‍A BILL.Definition: a formal statement of a planned new law that is discussed before being voted on

‍PETITIONING.Definition: to make a formal request for something, especially in a law court

‍MOTTO.Definition: a short sentence or phrase that expresses a belief or purpose

‍SLOGAN.Definition: a short easily remembered phrase, especially one used to advertise an idea or a product

‍FED UP.Definition: bored, annoyed, or disappointed, especially by something that you have experienced for too long

‍DISRUPT.Definition: to prevent something, especially a system, process, or event, from continuing as usual or as expected

‍HUNGER STRIKE.Definition: the act of refusing to eat in order to make a protest

‍RIDICULED.Definition: unkind words or actions that make someone or something look stupid

‍BELITTLE.Definition: to make a person or an action seem as if he, she or it is not important

‍VITAL.Definition: necessary for the success or continued existence of something; extremely important ‍

FURTHER.Definition: to develop or make progress in something

‍TRIALS.Definition: the hearing of statements and showing of objects, etc. in a law court to judge if a person is guilty of a crime or to decide a case or a legal matter

‍COURT.Definition: a place where trials and other legal cases happen, or the people present in such a place, especially the officials and those deciding if someone is guilty

‍MILITANT.Definition: active, determined, and often willing to use force

‍TRACK.Definition: the part of a racecourse where the horses run

‍BANNER.Definition: a long piece of cloth with words written on it, sometimes stretched between two poles and carried by people taking part in a march

‍NONSENSE.Definition: an idea, something said or written, or behaviour that is silly or stupid

‍PREVAILING.Definition: existing in a particular place or at a particular time

‍FRONT.Definition: a military front or battlefront is a contested armed frontier between opposing forces

‍BULLETS.Definition: a small, metal object that is shot from a gun

‍PAVE THE WAY.Definition: if something paves the way for/to something else, it makes the other thing possible

‍SIDE NOTE.Definition: a minor related mention, a non-related point

‍MARCH.Definition: an event in which a large number of people walk through a public place to express their support for something, or their disagreement with or disapproval of something

‍GRANT.Definition: to give or allow someone something, usually in an official way

‍NOTABLE.Definition: important and deserving attention, because of being very good or interesting

‍A HANDFUL.Definition: a small number of people or things

‍TURN IN YOUR GRAVE.Definition: if you say that a dead person would turn in their grave, you mean that they would be very angry or upset about something
